title: Quality Assurance Analyst
description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.<p><br></p>At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.<p><br></p>To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>Community Development is responsible for managing the Bank’s Community Impact initiatives, providing financing to support community development in the communities we serve and cultivating relationships and partnerships with our local communities. CIBC Bank USA is committed to supporting causes that matter to our clients, our employees and our communities. We aim to make a difference in communities through specialized community development financing, corporate donations, sponsorships and the volunteer spirit of our employees.<p><br></p><strong>What you'll be doing:</strong><p><br></p>The Quality Assurance Analyst’s primary role will be to support the Community Development Group to ensure compliance with regulatory and CIBC reporting requirements and monitoring of the existing Community Development Group loan portfolio.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Primarily responsible for ensuring the Community Development Group’s compliance with Regulation B on a daily basis. Complete required Regulation B reporting to CIBC’s Compliance team on a monthly basis.</li><li>Completion of the risk rating validation of the Community Development Group loan portfolio on a quarterly basis (including fiscal year end).</li><li>Completion of monthly reporting on non-performing, criticized and past due loans to CIBC’s Credit Risk Management team.</li><li>Review transactions closed on a monthly basis to document and report any credit exceptions to Community Development Group’s credit policy and procedures. Assist with the reporting of credit exceptions to the Small Business Exception Forum.</li><li>Completion of Notices of Default and Collection letters to Community Development Group customers that are past due on loan payments (including loan maturities).</li><li>Provide necessary loan documents to CIBC’s outside collection agency for transactions that are transferred to collections.</li><li>Complete necessary reporting on Community Development Group real estate transactions.</li><li>Provide supporting documentation to support ongoing Compliance monitoring as well as annual Compliance audits.</li><li>Complete the necessary reporting to Compliance associated with any formal complaints received from existing or prospective Community Development Group customers.</li><li>Assist with updates of business-specific processes and procedures, as applicable, in alignment with existing frameworks, policies, standards, and risk appetites.</li><li>Assist with the account management including the monitoring of past due payments received from of distressed portfolio accounts. </li><li>Work with Governance &amp; Controls teams (1Bs) or Internal Audit as needed to respond to Internal Audit reviews and findings.</li><li>Support procedural training (as applicable)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compliance Requirements/Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p>Our CIBC risk culture is based on employees striving to exceed the expectations of ourselves and our leadership’s identification and mitigation of risks in their daily responsibilities, not just in quarterly or annual monitoring/assessments. We all are accountable for managing risk.<p><br></p>As an employee of CIBC the incumbent must conduct themselves (and foster an environment for others) in a manner consistent with our strong risk culture. This includes:<p><br></p><ul><li>Following all aspects of the CIBC Code of Conduct, as well as all applicable CIBC policies, frameworks, guidelines, processes and controls</li><li>At all times acting in accordance with our Purpose and shared values, to achieve our Bank’s strategic goals</li><li>Understanding and following the qualitative and quantitative components of our Risk Appetite Statements</li><li>Completing all annual Corporate Mandatory Training and Testing modules, as well as any additional business-specific modules, as required and employing the learnings in daily activities and undertakings</li><li>Escalating matters through one of the appropriate channels identified in the CIBC Code of Conduct (i.e., HR, management, Ethics Hotline, Whistleblower, etc.) upon observing activities that may be inconsistent with CIBC’s policies, frameworks, guidelines, processes and controls</li><li>Speaking up if witnessing behaviors that drive poor or unfair outcomes for clients, team members or other stakeholders</li><li>Escalating matters that can result in adverse market practices and outcomes, thereby negatively impacting CIBC’s reputation as a leading financial institution</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge and Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>College education and equivalent of 3+ years of job experience in financial services industry.</li><li>Proficiency in banking applications and Microsoft suite of products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)</li><li>Possess creative problem-solving abilities</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication</li><li>Good organizational skills including attention to detail and follow through</li><li>Ability to work well under compressed time constraints</li><li>Ability to manage multiple tasks/projects at one time</li></ul><p><br></p>California residents — your privacy rights regarding your actual or prospective employment<p><br></p><strong>What you need to know:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com</li><li>You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Location</strong><p><br></p>IL-120 S LaSalle St<p><br></p><strong>Employment Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Weekly Hours</strong><p><br></p>40<p><br></p><strong>Skills</strong><p><br></p>Accounting, Business, Credit, Lending, Risk Management

title: Program Officer - Education [Crown Family Philanthropies] - Hybrid
description: Position DescriptionCrown Family Philanthropies (CFP or the Foundation) seeks a Program Officer, Education with at least seven years' education research, policy, and/or practical expertise, and authentic interest in achieving positive social impact. Experience and interest in early childhood education/kindergarten readiness/prek-3rd grade issues a plus. Successful candidates will demonstrate a natural intellectual curiosity and appetite for learning, the technical abilities to manage grantmaking operations, and the appetite and skills to provide education sector thought leadership.ResponsibilitiesPlanning and strategy:* Work with the Education Program team (Committee Chair, Associate Chair, Program Director, and other Program staff) to develop impact strategy and goals, guide direction of portfolio, develop grant recommendations, assess current grant initiatives, and coordinate learning opportunities aligned with strategic framework. Coordinate with the Program Director to support and lead portions of effective, dynamic committee meetings. Guide the Committee through the grant approval process and through strategic review and decision-making.* Establish and/or maintain diverse issue area expertise across the Education program priority areas with experience and interest in early childhood education/kindergarten readiness/prek-3rd grade issues a plus. Identify and bring in experts around specific questions to inform strategic impact and educate the Committee and board.* Collaborate with other grantmakers on field-wide activities that build on Committee strategies. Build and maintain deep relationships with diverse stakeholders, working closely with grantees, funders and other external stakeholders to maximize impact on systems change. Understand best practices and immediate needs.* Lead analyses on grantee organizations and grant outcomes. Lead the design of data collection tools and the development of narrative and oral presentations resulting from analysis. Develop and maintain frameworks to evaluate impact of grants and support the Committee's data dashboard.Leadership:* Serve as a key staff contact for Education Committee, including primary staff contact for select grants* Provide oversight and mentorship to program analyst(s) and/or senior program analyst(s), including ongoing professional development.* Identify areas of possible cross collaboration with the Foundation's other issue areas.* Serve as an active participant and leader in relevant associations and convenings at the local and national level. Represent Foundation as a thought leader in the field, locally and nationally.Grantmaking:* Develop, facilitate, and leverage relationships with grantee partners, funders, and other external stakeholders to collaborate on efforts and maximize impact* Research and analyze nonprofit organizations to determine fit with CFP's strategic priorities; invite proposal submissions, as applicable.* Contribute critical feedback to inform decisions on whether to accept or decline proposals based on established criteria.* Analyze nonprofit financial statements and operational conditions to determine organizational strength and effectiveness. Formulate recommendations for grant size and term.* Plan and conduct site visits, representing CFP to candidate organizations and grantees.* Lead the preparation of materials for Committee meetings, including grant summaries, progress reports, grants dockets, budget materials, meeting minutes, and additional content as assigned.QualificationsRequired ExperienceEducation: Bachelor's degree is required; advanced degree or commensurate experience preferredYears of Experience: Minimum of seven years of progressive experience in a foundation, non-profit, government agency, and/or a research institution working on program-related issues in the education sector; title: Systems Engineer
description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.<p><br></p>At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.<p><br></p>To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>Overview:<p><br></p>This role requires extensive familiarity with Windows, Linux servers and frequently involves user support tasks. description: At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.<p><br></p>Today’s world is fueled by vast amounts of information. Data is more valuable than ever before. Protecting data and information systems is central to doing business, and everyone in EY Information Security has a critical role to play. Join a global team of almost 950 people who collaborate to support the business of EY by protecting EY and client information assets! Our Information Security professionals enable EY to work securely and deliver secure products and services, as well as detect and quickly respond to security events as they happen. Together, the efforts of our dedicated team help protect the EY brand and build client trust.<p><br></p>Within Information Security we blend risk strategy, digital identity, cyber defense, application security and technology solutions as we consider the entire security lifecycle. You will join a team of hardworking, security-focused individuals dedicated to supporting, protecting and enabling the business through innovative, secure solutions that provide speed to market and business value.<p><br></p><strong>The opportunity</strong><p><br></p>The Encryption Engineer will be a member of the Digital Certificate Technology Services team within the Information Security Identity and Access Management Services (IAMS) team. This Engineer will deploy, configure and maintain centralized key management services to provide end-to-end lifecycle management, governance and security of sensitive key material.<p><br></p><strong>Your Key Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>Deploy and configure enterprise key management and hardware security module (HSM) tools, which will centralize key lifecycle administration across the global EY platform for data at rest and data in transit. Your responsibilities include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Deploy and configure the Firm’s enterprise key management tools.</li><li>Deploy and configure the Firm’s Hardware Security Module.</li><li>Implement process automations as it relates to enterprise key management and HSM administration.</li><li>Maintain and update the enterprise key management tools to support new business requirements while maintaining the fundamentals of a centralised key management service.</li><li>Support integration of HSMs to support Apache, Nginx, Windows IIS and Java keystores.</li><li>Support cloud application teams in centralizing storage of sensitive key material in proprietary repositories such as Azure Key Vault (AKV) and Goggle Cloud Key Management Services while aligning to the overall EY key management strategy.</li><li>Provide Level 3 and 4 support to operational team on key management which has a direct impact of the Recovery Time Objective (RTO).</li><li>Document operational procedures for deployment and configuration of security appliances.Update system configuration runbook regularly.</li><li>Lead HSM engineering and enterprise key management efforts across the internal infrastructure and cloud environments.</li><li>Work with cross functional teams and collaborate with IAM Operations.</li><li>Research on impact of future computer security standards such as Federal Information Processing Standard 140-3 (FIPS 140-3), Cryptographic Module Validation Program (CMVP), Common Criteria (ISO/IEC 15408) on EY key management service (KMS) strategy.</li><li>Research quantum computing and suggest areas of EY KMS strategy that require updates.</li><li>Provide subject matter expertise on HSM, FIPS, CMVP, ISO/IEC 15408 to project teams, and other audiences as needed.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Skills And Attributes For Success</strong><p><br></p>A successful candidate for this role impacts EY business by deploying and configuring security tools recommended in EY KMS strategy. As such, candidates must possess:<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with Key Management Life Cycle - Key Generation, Storage, Distribution, Backup, Rotation, Revocation, Destruction, etc.</li><li>Experience with major enterprise key management systems as well as cloud-based key management services.</li><li>Hands on experience and knowledge of TLS, PKI, HSMs, KMIP, Digital Certificate Management, Azure Key Vault, and transparent database encryption.</li><li>Experience with FIPS 140-2 compliance requirements and implementation.</li><li>Experience in security key management, security standards, cryptography, certificate management lifecycle and PKI.</li><li>Understanding of cloud computing architecture, technical design, and implementation.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>To qualify for the role, you must have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or 8 years Security Engineering Experience or equivalent.</li><li>5+ years’ experience in enterprise key management, HSM configuration, application layer encryption, and transparent data encryption.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Ideally, you’ll also have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience working with diverse, globally distributed teams.</li><li>Ability to work well in a highly matrixed environment yet builds credibility to drive execution outside of direct chain of command while working across all organizational levels.</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.</li><li>A security industry certification such as Security+, Network+, Cryptography Certification. </li><li>Ability to work independently or with a team, under minimum supervision.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We Look For</strong><p><br></p>A successful candidate for this role would be expected to be a problem solver with the ability to assess situations from multiple perspectives. They will demonstrate persistence, originality and ability to apply technical concepts to solve complex business challenges. The ability to network with key stakeholders and sponsors, work across multiple teams, make sense of complexity and uncertainty, recognize and navigate issues, articulate thoughts and opinions, assert pragmatic ideas and influence, and present to a variety of audiences are required characteristics of the successful candidate.<p><br></p><strong>What We Offer</strong><p><br></p>The compensation ranges below are provided in order to comply with United States pay transparency laws. Other geographies will follow their local salary guidelines, which may not be a direct conversion of published US salary range/s.<p><br></p>We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The salary range for this job in most geographic locations in the US is $126,800 to $0230,100. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $0152,200 to $261,500. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.<p><br></p><ul><li>Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.</li><li>Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.</li><li>Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.</li><li>Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please apply to this role only through the ‘Apply’ link (not through the local office). Your application will then be routed to the appropriate recruiting team. </strong><p><br></p><strong>The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.</strong><p><br></p><strong>EY | Building a better working world</strong><p><br></p>EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.<p><br></p>Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.<p><br></p>Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.<p><br></p>EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable law.<p><br></p>EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. title: Postdoctoral Appointee – Heavy-Duty Non-Road Engine Modeling
description: The Multiphysics Computation Section at Argonne National Laboratory is seeking to hire a postdoctoral appointee. The successful candidate’s research will involve synergistic collaborations with a multidisciplinary team involving engine modelers, CFD and AI/ML experts, and computational scientists to enhance the predictive capability and scalability of multi-scale and multi-physics simulation codes.<p><br></p>The candidate will perform multi-physics and multi-scale computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations involving multi-phase flows, turbulent combustion, and heat transfer phenomena for heavy-duty, non-road internal combustion engines (ICEs) by further developing commercial/in-house codes and leveraging high-performance computing (HPC).<p><br></p><ul><li>Develop accurate and computationally efficient CFD models to simulate the chain of physics and chemistry involved with fuel injection, fuel-air mixing, turbulent combustion, and emissions for off-road, rail, and marine engines.</li><li>Perform high-fidelity simulations of heavy-duty ICEs that involve both conventional and low-carbon fuels, such as biodiesel, methanol, and hydrogen.</li><li>Improve the accuracy of two-phase flow models for dynamic coupling of the internal nozzle flow with the ensuing spray in simulations of direct injection applications.</li><li>Develop surrogate models and reduced chemical kinetic models for complex fuels, enabling efficient incorporation of detailed chemistry in engine CFD.</li><li>Work as a part of a multidisciplinary team involving experimentalists, CFD experts, and computational scientists to enable cutting-edge CFD modeling &amp; simulations on the next generation supercomputing architectures.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Position Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ph.D. in mechanical/aerospace engineering, applied mathematics, chemical engineering, or a related discipline.</li><li>Experience in modeling and simulation of three-dimensional two-phase and/or multiphase turbulent reacting flow applications using CFD codes (e.g., CONVERGE, Ansys Fluent, OpenFOAM, etc.).</li><li>Knowledge of internal combustion engine combustion theory and modeling, extensive knowledge of liquid and gaseous fuels for engine applications, good understanding of turbulence, spray, chemical kinetics, reacting flow physics, and turbulent combustion modeling.</li><li>Knowledge of multi-dimensional code development (in C++/C/Fortran) for two-phase/multiphase flow and turbulent combustion applications, and parallel scientific computing,</li><li>Experience in geometry manipulation with computer-aided design software.</li><li>Ability to demonstrate collaborative skills, including the ability to work well with other divisions, laboratories, and universities.</li><li>Skilled communication skills at all levels of the organization.</li><li>Experience presenting and publishing results in peer reviewed society technical reports and journal articles.</li><li>A successful candidate must have the ability to model Argonne’s Core Values: Impact, Safety, Respect, Integrity, and Teamwork.</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in interdisciplinary collaborative research.</li><li>Knowledge of deep machine learning (using TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.) for multi-fidelity modeling, regression tasks, management and analysis of large datasets, and parallel scientific computing.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Family</strong><p><br></p>Postdoctoral Family<p><br></p><strong>Job Profile</strong><p><br></p>Postdoctoral Appointee<p><br></p><strong>Worker discovery and innovation.
